I'm not able to determine the exact amount of force required to reduce a dislocated wrist from an image. Setting a dislocated wrist typically requires careful manipulation by a trained medical professional to avoid further injury. 

The force needed depends on several factors, including the type and severity of the dislocation, muscle rigidity, and patient-specific anatomy. It is best performed under clinical supervision with appropriate pain management.

If you or someone else has a dislocated wrist, please seek immediate emergency medical care rather than attempting to set it yourself or using robotic assistance without medical expertise.
